sen.j: 海印寺（かいいんじ）は、京都府長岡京市にあった寺院、およびその周辺の地名。
sen.e: Kaiin-ji was the name of a Buddhist temple located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture and is also currently the name of the surrounding area.
Kaiin-ji was the name of a Buddhist temple located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture and is also currently the name of the surrounding area.
Kaiin-ji was the name of a Buddhist temple located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture and is also currently the name of the surrounding area.

sen.j: 一説にモウソウチクが初めて伝わった場所とも言われる。
sen.e: One theory claims it to be the place where the Phyllostachys edulis species of bamboo was first introduced to Japan.
One theory claims it to be the place where the Phyllostachys edulis species of bamboo was first introduced to Japan.
One theory claims it to be the place where the Phyllostachys edulis species of bamboo was first introduced to Japan.

sen.j: 9世紀始めに道雄によって創建された。
sen.e: It was founded in the early 9th century by Doyu.
It was founded in the early 9th century by Doyu.
It was founded in the early ninth century by Doyu.

sen.j: かつては国家･皇室の庇護を受けて栄え、周辺の村々を海印寺領とした時期もあった。
sen.e: The temple once flourished under the patronage of the government and imperial family, and the surrounding villages were designated as Kaiin-ji Temple territory.
The temple once flourished under the patronage of the government and imperial family, and the surrounding villages were designated as Kaiin-ji Temple territory.
The temple once flourished under the patronage of the government and imperial family, and the surrounding villages were designated as Kaiin-ji Temple territory.

sen.j: 寺としては現在は廃れ、海印寺十院と呼ばれたうち寂照院のみが残る。
sen.e: It no longer functions as a temple and Jakusho-in Temple is the only one of its ten sub-temples to remain.
It no longer functions as a temple and Jakusho-in Temple is the only one of its ten sub-temples to remain.
It no longer functions as a temple and Jakusho-in Temple is the only one of its ten sub-temples to remain.

sen.j: 同市内の旧海印寺村地域の地名や施設名等にその名が残る。
sen.e: The name 'Kaiinji' remains used within Nagaokakyo City to refer to the area of the former Kaiin-ji Temple village as well as various institutions.
The name 'Kaiinji' remains used within Nagaokakyo City to refer to the area of the former Kaiin-ji Temple village as well as various institutions.
